result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(Case called at 11:22 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Robert Arcoro appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Katherine Cook. ADA Monica Fallon appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and updates the Defendant's phone number. State requests $500 cash bond indicating no community ties. Defense requests signature bond indicating appearances can be made by Zoom. Court orders $10,000 signature bond with various conditions. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/08/2022 at 2:45 PM. 
Hearing: 08/31/2022 at 9:30 AM. 
Defense requests Zoom for the Defendant. State objects. Court orders the Defendant must make in person appearances.

Conditions:
